154122.content:
Your belly was definitely distended. Waaaaay bigger than the tiny bulge it was yesterday. On your body, you'd say it's about 7 or 8 months? You drum it with your hands, trying to wake your daughter up, and to get her kicking. There's no reply, but you figured as much. She's probably tired. Growing is hard work, as you can attest to, from yesterday. You lay your hands on either side and smile. Your heritage gave you the desire to have children one day, but you didn't think it would be so soon~

There's a faint glowing projected onto the wall of your mother's womb. You know what it is - the glowing symbol that marks you as pregnant with a monster girl - and you move your hands to cover it. The light is blocked, and you play for a bit, covering and uncovering it to flash the light. You giggle, and rub around your umbilical cord. You're positive your belly button would've popped out by now, if it was't part of your cord. A part of you wishes that you're born soon, but you can't argue with the comfortable feeling of where you are.

Your thoughts are interrupted by a taste flooding your mouth. You open and close it a few times, but it mostly just swishes some fluid. It kind of tastes like chocolate, and there's something else... french toast? She must have made breakfast while you were playing with your tummy.

It doesn't take long for the sugar to hit you. You start to become energetic, and feels uncomfortable to just sit still. As a result, you start to go to town, squirming and wiggling all about, your tail whipping around and thrashing against the side of your mom's belly. You begin sucking your thumb, and with the other hand you punch at her belly button. There's an "Oof!", in response, and you stretch, head pressing against her cervix. "Ugh, that was a bad idea. Got you a little excited, huh?"

You recognize it as your mom's voice, and you nod. Then you remember she couldn't see that, so you wiggle instead. "Yeah sweetie, we'll be seeing each other soon." She pats the underside of her womb, right by your cheek. "I wonder if you're as excited to meet me as I am to meet you..."

You wiggle again, and her middle jiggles as she laughs. "I'll take that as a yes." There's some time spent cleaning the kitchen, but then your mom gets on with her day.
154122.title: Warm Welcome

154123.content:
Your belly is only slightly bigger than before, you are probably at about 3 months. However you can feel your child. You poke your belly and feel something resisting your touch, strange, then the information comes from your brain, from instinct. You have an egg! The egg is still growing though and will take another 6 months to be ready to be born.
As for now though you can just wait to be born, honestly you are excited to go out into the world and already your instincts are starting to make you a little restless. In response you wriggle around as your mother showers. You feel the water hit her belly and you like it, the steady thrum of water is soothing, it leaves much too soon and you squirm in protest.
You see a symbol glowing on your mother’s belly, the symbol of being pregnant with a monster girl, you giggle at the light and play around with it, it is a nice distraction from kissing the water thrum
Your mother steps out of the shower and does her morning routine you relax looking in awe at your belly, the life inside. You can’t wait for the pregnancy to be over to meet your own child!
You are snapped out of your daydreams by the wonderful taste of waffles. Yum! After breakfast your mother gets dressed and goes outside. What does she do?
154123.title: Fairly small. Well-developed, but small

1541231.content:
Your mother starts to jog, as you bounce around you get annoyed. Your mother has been a fitness nut during the entire pregnancy, and jogging is kind of uncomfortable. You punch her in protest but she keeps on going.

Soon you can hear the crunching of leaves, your mother is jogging through the old forest trail. Then she stops.
“Hey there pretty, what are you doing out here alone, hehehe” a creepy voice said, you punched your mother, she needed to get out of here. Then your mother falls back, oof you feel your mothers back collide with a branch.
“Give me the book pretty, I need it!” the creepy man says,
“No! What do you even need it for” your mom replies.
The man whispers something you can’t hear. Your mother gets back up, you feel an energy before your mother starts falling again.
Crack! You feel the branch your mother landed on, and you feel her amniotic sac bursting.
No! You are not ready
What do you do! You can feel your instincts wanting to take hold though they are primal and may not be the best thing to do. Do you surrender to your instincts or wait this out?
1541231.title: Jogging
